intro: Elymus varius, commonly known as the slender wheatgrass, is a perennial grass native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows in open, disturbed sites such as roadsides, fields, and riverbanks. The plant has slender,丛生 stems that can reach heights of up to 1 meter, with narrow, grass-like leaves. Elymus varius is characterized by its ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions and its role in stabilizing soil in erosion-prone areas.
